meanings.definition: A person who advocates or works towards liberation.
meanings.sent1: The liberationists organized a peaceful protest for equal rights.
meanings.sent2: Many liberationists fought for the freedom of all people.
meanings.sent3: The liberationists planned a surprise party to liberate their friend from stress.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a beacon of hope to the liberationists in their darkest hour.
meanings.sent5: The image of the liberationists marching together will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Those who seek to achieve freedom or release from oppression or constraints.
meanings.sent1: The liberationists believed in breaking free from all forms of tyranny.
meanings.sent2: In history, liberationists have always stood up against injustice.
meanings.sent3: The liberationists joked that their cat was a liberationist trying to escape the house.
meanings.sent4: The music was a liberationist, setting free the emotions trapped within.
meanings.sent5: The courage of the liberationists shone brightly in the face of adversity.
